alert.note: Alert for Adams; Allen; Blackford; Grant; Huntington; Jay; Miami; Wabash; Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 9:38AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Allen, Wabash, Grant, Blackford, Huntington, Wells, Adams, Jay, southeastern Miami and central Van Wert Counties through 1115 AM EDT... At 937 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Kokomo to 6 miles northeast of Alexandria to 6 miles south of Union City. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bunker Hill and Matthews around 950 AM EDT. Jonesboro around 955 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hartford City, Gas City, Upland, Peru, Van Buren, Wabash, North Manchester and Markle. This includes the following highways... Interstate 469 between mile markers 0 and 3, and between mile markers 7 and 8. Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 252 and 296. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Northern Indiana. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EDT for central, north central, northeastern and east central Indiana...and west central Ohio.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Allen; Blackford; Grant; Huntington; Jay; Miami; Wabash; Wells
